help.title: How to use the system
help.description: This system uses artificial intelligence to detect and classify brain tumors in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
help.step1: Click on the upload area or drag a brain magnetic resonance image
help.step2: Wait for the image to be processed by artificial intelligence
help.step3: The system will identify if there is a tumor and what type
help.step4: View the result with classification and confidence level
help.meningiomaDesc: Tumor that develops in the meninges, the membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord. They are usually benign and slow-growing.
help.gliomaDesc: Tumor that originates in the glial cells of the brain. It can range from low to high grade of malignancy and is one of the most common types of brain tumors.
help.pituitaryDesc: Tumor that develops in the pituitary gland (hypophysis), responsible for producing important hormones. Most are benign, but can affect hormonal balance.
help.noTumorDesc: Brain image that shows no signs of tumor. Used as a reference for comparison with images containing tumors.
help.noteText: This system is a diagnostic aid tool. Results should always be evaluated by a qualified healthcare professional.

about.title: About the Project
about.subtitle: Information about the development and objectives of this project.
about.description: This project was developed using Next.js 16 with React 19 and shadcn/ui to create a modern and responsive interface. The goal is to provide a solid foundation for web application development.
about.tech2: React 19 - JavaScript library for building user interfaces
about.tech3: TypeScript - JavaScript superset with static typing
about.tech6: Lucide React - Modern and elegant icons
about.objectives: Create a scalable, maintainable application with excellent user experience, following modern web development best practices.
